I organize the Before & After series and cover DIY and design. I joined AT in October 2020 as a production assistant. I have an MA in Journalism from the University of Missouri and a BA in Journalism from Belmont University. Past editorial stops include HGTV Magazine, Nashville Arts Magazine, and local magazines in my hometown, Columbia, Missouri.

published about 5 hours ago

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

There are a few basic tools — think: hammer, screwdriver, pliers — you should have if you want to do minor repairs and projects, like hang artwork, tighten loose knobs, or swap out your light switch plates. Are these items necessarily “fun” to buy? No. Are they pretty? Also no. At least, that’s what I thought until I saw this cool electric screwdriver at the MoMA Design store. 

It’s no surprise that an institution that celebrates design would sell maybe the chicest home repair tool I’ve ever seen — and one that will make some of my least favorite DIY jobs easier at that.

The HOTO Electric 3.6V Cordless Screwdriver is a compact size, cordless, and comes in an aesthetic colorway. Even better, it has a built-in LED light to illuminate your subject, which will help you tackle fixes in tight corners or dim crannies, like the back of your television or the interior of a drawer. 

Reasons to Love the HOTO Electric 3.6V Cordless Screwdriver

Because of its price tag, it’s worth noting that you don’t necessarily need a screwdriver this fancy if all you’re doing is tightening loose knobs and swapping out batteries in devices from time to time, but I think it’s worth the splurge for several reasons.

  1. If you live in a small apartment, the compact size of this tool will appeal to you. It’s small-but-powerful and comes with a zip-up pouch for easy storage. 
  2. If you tackle multiple DIY projects per month, or if you’re planning a move involving flat-pack furniture, an electric screwdriver is the way to go. In 2023, I asked a TaskRabbit tasker, Vanessa Garcia (who has assembled over 170 pieces of flat-pack furniture), for her most-recommended tool, and she said an electric screwdriver to speed up assembly jobs.
  3. The battery lasts a long time. In fact, the HOTO screwdriver can screw in up to 300 screws before needing a recharge!
  4. If aesthetics are important to you, or if you keep your DIY materials out on display, this screwdriver is a front-runner and would look especially chic on a desk, workbench, or a pegboard. 

After seeing this screwdriver at MoMA, I can’t get enough of HOTO’s tools in general — I also have my eye on their hot glue gun and electric scrub brush for upcoming projects. Très chic!
